message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the design and analysis of pattern matching algorithms, which is a fundamental problem in computer science. The focus is on optimizing the speed of these algorithms, which suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a general method for computing the limit of the expected speed of pattern matching algorithms, which involves probabilistic analysis, indicating that the paper may also belong to the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category. The paper also proposes a polynomial heuristic for dealing with patterns of length greater than 4, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.CC (Computational Complexity) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper involves information theory, as it discusses the concept of entropy, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Finally, the paper compares the proposed approaches with pre-existing pattern matching algorithms from both a theoretical and practical point of view, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
